greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Swinging polynomials, coefficients read by rows.
comment: Let p(n,x) = (1+x^2)^n+n*x*(1+x^2)^(n-1), then T(n,k) are the coefficients of these polynomials, read by rows, n = 0,1,...
The central numbers of the rows, i.e., the coefficients of x^n of p(n,x), are the swinging factorial numbers A056040(n).
link: Peter Luschny, Die schwingende Fakultät und Orbitalsysteme, August 2011.
example: The central coefficients are marked by [].
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := If[EvenQ[k], Binomial[n, k/2], Binomial[n, (k-1)/2]*(n-(k-1)/2)]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, 7}, {k, 0, 2*n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 28 2013 *)
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Jun 28 2009
